fields.name: Harvard University
fields.description: Harvard University is devoted to excellence in teaching, learning, and research, and to developing leaders who make a difference globally.

fields.name: Columbia University
fields.description: Columbia University is one of the world's most important centers of research and at the same time a distinctive and distinguished learning environment for undergraduates and graduate students in many scholarly and professional fields.

fields.name: City of Nashville
fields.description: Nashville is the capital and most populous city of the U.S. state of Tennessee. It is the county seat of Davidson County and is located on the Cumberland River.[7] With a population of 689,447 as of the 2020 U.S. census,[5] Nashville is the 21st most-populous city in the United States and the fourth most populous city in the Southeastern United States.

fields.name: Nashville Software School
fields.description: NSS is a flourishing community of 1400+ alumni, 250+ active students, and a team of dedicated instructors helping each other grow and learn their craft.

fields.name: Vanderbilt University
fields.description: Vanderbilt is a private research university in Nashville, Tennessee. It offers 70 undergraduate majors and a full range of graduate and professional degrees.
